N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 620.1 - Eligibility

State Regulations
(a) Any trainee who
has been referred to and is at regular attendance at a training course
established in accordance with the provisions of article 23- A of the Labor Law
shall be eligible for State training allowances, except as provided in this
section. (b) No State training
allowances shall be payable to a trainee who, without having been graduated
from a high school, has attended school during the 12- month period preceding
the beginning of the training course, except that sporadic and short-time
school attendance within that period may be disregarded and that this
subdivision shall not apply to a trainee: (1)
whose return to school would not be practicable because of special personal
circumstances, or
(2)
who attended
special education classes, or equivalent courses, if it is shown that he has
attained the highest level of achievement for his capabilities in the existing
school program. (c) No

State regular training allowances shall be payable to a trainee while two other
members of his family, living in the same household with him, are receiving
such allowances. Notes
